author: acolytec3
content: I'm on the EthereumJS team and working on implementing the `NEW_BLOCK` message in our client and have a question about the block propagation spec as it applies to this message.  https://github.com/ethereum/devp2p/blob/master/caps/eth.md#block-propagation Here in the spec, it says to just validate the PoW in the header of the block received from a peer, propagate that to a subset of all connected peers, and then actually process the block, insert into the local chain, and only then broadcast `NEW_BLOCK_HASHES` after the block is fully processed.  Is there a reason for splitting up the PoW validation before re-broadcasting `NEW_BLOCK` from block processing and broadcasting `NEW_BLOCK_HASHES`?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content:
Yes block processing takes quite a long time so we like to broadcast the block as fast as possible 
Thus we only check the PoW to be "reasonably sure" that the block is somewhat valid
